MOTORCYCLING_O -_O *OOV*_O WIN_O *OOV*_O ROUND_O *OOV*_O *OOV*_O *OOV*_O ._O
*OOV*_O ,_O Japan_O 1996-08-25_O
*OOV*_O *OOV*_O Takeda_O ,_O racing_O in_O only_O his_O first_O season_O ,_O *OOV*_O the_O big_O names_O to_O win_O the_O first_O race_O in_O round_O nine_O of_O the_O world_O *OOV*_O championship_O on_O Sunday_O ._O
Takeda_O ,_O 18_O ,_O showed_O *OOV*_O far_O beyond_O his_O years_O to_O *OOV*_O Australian_O Ducati_O rider_O Troy_O Corser_O ,_O last_O year_O 's_O championship_O runner-up_O ,_O with_O four_O of_O the_O 25_O laps_O left_O ._O
Honda_O 's_O Takeda_O was_O *OOV*_O past_O Corser_O by_O the_O Yamaha_O *OOV*_O of_O Noriyuki_O Haga_O and_O Wataru_O Yoshikawa_O with_O Haga_O briefly_O taking_O the_O lead_O in_O the_O final_O *OOV*_O on_O the_O last_O lap_O ._O
But_O Takeda_O found_O one_O more_O *OOV*_O of_O power_O to_O just_O take_O the_O flag_O first_O with_O Haga_O second_O and_O Yoshikawa_O third_O ._O
Haga_O had_O the_O consolation_O of_O *OOV*_O the_O fastest_O lap_O at_O *OOV*_O kph_O ._O
Corser_O ,_O who_O crashed_O during_O *OOV*_O on_O Friday_O ,_O *OOV*_O in_O fourth_O ,_O four_O seconds_O behind_O Takeda_O with_O championship_O leader_O *OOV*_O Slight_O of_O New_O Zealand_O 11_O seconds_O behind_O the_O winner_O ._O
In_O the_O second_O race_O ,_O Takeda_O again_O challenged_O strongly_O until_O the_O fifth_O lap_O from_O the_O end_O when_O he_O crashed_O while_O running_O second_O to_O *OOV*_O race_O winner_O Takuma_O Aoki_O ._O
Aoki_O ,_O the_O *OOV*_O brother_O of_O reigning_O *OOV*_O world_O champion_O *OOV*_O ,_O had_O a_O *OOV*_O *OOV*_O with_O John_O Kocinski_O of_O the_O United_O States_O on_O a_O Ducati_O before_O taking_O the_O *OOV*_O flag_O ._O
Kocinski_O led_O for_O the_O early_O laps_O before_O he_O was_O passed_O first_O by_O Aoki_O ,_O who_O recorded_O the_O fastest_O lap_O of_O 147.786_O kph_O ,_O and_O then_O by_O Takeda_O ._O
With_O Takeda_O out_O of_O the_O race_O ,_O Kocinski_O regained_O second_O place_O but_O he_O could_O not_O *OOV*_O Aoki_O ._O
Haga_O again_O was_O the_O *OOV*_O rider_O finishing_O third_O ahead_O of_O Slight_O with_O Corser_O in_O 10th_O place_O ._O
But_O the_O strong_O showing_O by_O the_O Japanese_O riders_O did_O not_O *OOV*_O the_O championship_O table_O with_O Slight_O still_O leading_O on_O 280_O points_O ,_O followed_O by_O Corser_O with_O *OOV*_O and_O Kocinski_O with_O 254_O ._O

Brian_O *OOV*_O
RIO_O DE_O JANEIRO_O 1996-08-26_O
Two_O key_O players_O left_O a_O Brazilian_O championship_O match_O early_O on_O Sunday_O because_O they_O had_O to_O catch_O a_O plane_O to_O Russia_O to_O play_O with_O the_O national_O team_O ._O

Martin_O *OOV*_O

Britain_O 's_O Chris_O Boardman_O fulfilled_O his_O *OOV*_O that_O he_O would_O break_O the_O world_O 4,000_O metres_O world_O record_O in_O the_O world_O track_O cycling_O championships_O on_O Wednesday_O ._O
Boardman_O clocked_O four_O minutes_O *OOV*_O seconds_O to_O *OOV*_O more_O than_O six_O seconds_O from_O the_O previous_O world_O mark_O of_O *OOV*_O set_O by_O Olympic_O champion_O Andrea_O Collinelli_O of_O Italy_O in_O Atlanta_O in_O July_O ._O
